query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 Non era ancor di là Nesso arrivato, 2 quando noi ci mettemmo per un bosco 3 che da neun sentiero era segnato.
query.result:
**English:**
1 Nessus had not yet arrived on the other side, 2 when we set out through a wood 3 that was marked by no path.
**Malay:**
1 Nessus belum sampai di seberang sana, 2 ketika kami memasuki hutan 3 yang tidak ditandai oleh jalan setapak.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
7 Non han sì aspri sterpi né sì folti 8 quelle fiere selvagge che ’n odio hanno 9 tra Cecina e Corneto i luoghi cólti.
query.result:
**English:**
7 There are no such rough thickets or dense undergrowth 8 as those wild beasts that hate 9 the cultivated places between Cecina and Corneto.
**Malay:**
7 Tidak ada semak belukar yang begitu kasar atau begitu lebat 8 seperti binatang buas yang membenci 9 tempat-tempat yang ditanami antara Cecina dan Corneto.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
10 Quivi le brutte Arpie lor nidi fanno, 11 che cacciar de le Strofade i Troiani 12 con tristo annunzio di futuro danno.
query.result:
**English:**
10 Here the foul Harpies make their nests, 11 who drove the Trojans from the Strophades 12 with dire warnings of future harm.
**Malay:**
10 Di sini para Harpy yang keji membuat sarang mereka, 11 yang mengusir bangsa Troya dari Strophades 12 dengan ramalan buruk tentang bencana di masa depan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
13 Ali hanno late, e colli e visi umani, 14 piè con artigli, e pennuto ’l gran ventre; 15 fanno lamenti in su li alberi strani.
query.result:
**English:**
13 There they have broad wings, and human necks, 14 feet with claws, and their great bellies are feathered; 15 they make laments in the strange trees.
**Malay:**
13 Di sana mereka memiliki sayap yang lebar, dan leher manusia, 14 kaki dengan cakar, dan perut besar mereka berbulu; 15 mereka meratap di pohon-pohon yang aneh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
16 E ’l buon maestro «Prima che più entre, 17 sappi che se’ nel secondo girone», 18 mi cominciò a dire, «e sarai mentre
19 che tu verrai ne l’orribil sabbione.
query.result:
**English:**
16 And the good master, “Before you go any further, 17 know that you are in the second circle,” 18 began to say to me, “and you will be there until
19 you come to the horrible sand.
**Malay:**
16 Dan guru yang baik, “Sebelum kamu masuk lebih jauh, 17 ketahuilah bahwa kamu berada di lingkaran kedua,” 18 mulailah berkata kepadaku, “dan kamu akan berada di sana sampai
19 kamu sampai di pasir yang mengerikan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
20 Però riguarda ben; sì vederai 21 cose che torrien fede al mio sermone».
22 Io sentia d’ogne parte trarre guai 23 e non vedea persona che ’l facesse; 24 per ch’io tutto smarrito m’arrestai.
query.result:
**English:**
20 But look at it well; yes, you will see 21 things that would make my speech seem unbelievable».
22 I heard cries of pain from every side 23 and saw no one who made them; 24 so that, completely bewildered, I stopped.
**Malay:**
20 Tetapi perhatikanlah dengan baik; ya, kamu akan melihat 21 hal-hal yang akan membuat ucapanku tampak tidak dapat dipercaya».
22 Aku mendengar jeritan kesakitan dari setiap sisi 23 dan tidak melihat seorang pun yang melakukannya; 24 sehingga, benar-benar bingung, aku berhenti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
25 Cred’ ïo ch’ei credette ch’io credesse 26 che tante voci uscisser, tra quei bronchi, 27 da gente che per noi si nascondesse.
query.result:
**English:**
25 I believe that he believed that I believed 26 that so many voices came from among those branches, 27 from people who were hiding from us.
**Malay:**
25 Aku percaya bahwa ia percaya bahwa aku percaya 26 bahwa begitu banyak suara keluar dari antara cabang-cabang itu, 27 dari orang-orang yang bersembunyi dari kita.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
28 Però disse ’l maestro: «Se tu tronchi 29 qualche fraschetta d’una d’este piante, 30 li pensier c’hai si faran tutti monchi».
query.result:
**English:**
28 But the master said: "If you break off 29 a small branch from one of these trees, 30 the thoughts that you have will all become crippled."
**Malay:**
28 Tetapi sang guru berkata: "Jika kamu mematahkan 29 beberapa ranting dari salah satu pohon ini, 30 pikiran-pikiran yang kamu miliki akan menjadi cacat semua."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
31 Allor porsi la mano un poco avante 32 e colsi un ramicel da un gran pruno; 33 e ’l tronco suo gridò: «Perché mi schiante?».
query.result:
**English:**
31 Then I stretched out my hand a little forward 32 and plucked a branch from a great thorn bush; 33 and its trunk cried out: “Why do you break me?”.
**Malay:**
31 Kemudian aku mengulurkan tanganku sedikit ke depan 32 dan memetik ranting dari semak berduri yang besar; 33 dan batangnya berteriak: “Mengapa kamu meremukkanku?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
34 Da che fatto fu poi di sangue bruno, 35 ricominciò a dir: «Perché mi scerpi? 36 non hai tu spirto di pietade alcuno?
37 Uomini fummo, e or siam fatti sterpi: 38 ben dovrebb’ esser la tua man più pia, 39 se state fossimo anime di serpi».
query.result:
**English:**
34 Since he was then made of dark blood, 35 he began to say again: "Why do you tear me? 36 Do you have no spirit of pity at all?
37 We were men, and now we are made into shrubs: 38 your hand should be more merciful, 39 even if we were the souls of serpents".
**Malay:**
34 Sejak dia kemudian dibuat dari darah gelap, 35 dia mulai berkata lagi: "Mengapa kamu mencabik-cabikku? 36 Apakah kamu tidak memiliki sedikit pun rasa kasihan?
37 Kami adalah manusia, dan sekarang kami telah menjadi semak belukar: 38 tanganmu seharusnya lebih berbelas kasih, 39 bahkan jika kami adalah jiwa ular".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
40 Come d’un stizzo verde ch’arso sia 41 da l’un de’ capi, che da l’altro geme 42 e cigola per vento che va via,
43 sì de la scheggia rotta usciva insieme 44 parole e sangue; ond’ io lasciai la cima 45 cadere, e stetti come l’uom che teme.
query.result:
**English:**
40 Like a green stick that is burning at one end, 41 and at the other end groans and hisses 42 with the wind that escapes,
43 so from the broken splinter came forth together 44 words and blood; whereupon I let go of the tip 45 and stood like a man who is afraid.
**Malay:**
40 Seperti kayu hijau yang terbakar di salah satu ujungnya, 41 dan di ujung lainnya mengerang dan mendesis 42 oleh angin yang berlalu,
43 demikianlah dari serpihan yang patah keluar bersamaan 44 kata-kata dan darah; oleh karena itu aku melepaskan ujungnya 45 dan berdiri seperti orang yang takut.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
46 «S’elli avesse potuto creder prima», 47 rispuose ’l savio mio, «anima lesa, 48 ciò c’ha veduto pur con la mia rima,
49 non averebbe in te la man distesa; 50 ma la cosa incredibile mi fece 51 indurlo ad ovra ch’a me stesso pesa.
query.result:
**English:**
46 "If he could have believed before," 47 replied my wise guide, "wounded soul, 48 what he has seen even with my rhyme,
49 he would not have stretched out his hand against you; 50 but the incredible thing made me 51 persuade him to an act that weighs on me."
**Malay:**
46 "Jika dia bisa percaya sebelumnya," 47 jawab pembimbingku yang bijaksana, "jiwa yang terluka, 48 apa yang telah dilihatnya bahkan dengan rimaku,
49 dia tidak akan mengulurkan tangannya padamu; 50 tetapi hal yang luar biasa membuatku 51 membujuknya untuk melakukan tindakan yang membebaniku."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
52 Ma dilli chi tu fosti, sì che ’n vece 53 d’alcun’ ammenda tua fama rinfreschi 54 nel mondo sù, dove tornar li lece».
query.result:
**English:**
52 But tell me who you were, so that in place 53 of some amends I may refresh your fame 54 in the world above, where it is permitted to return.
**Malay:**
52 Tetapi ceritakan siapa dirimu, sehingga sebagai ganti 53 dari beberapa denda, aku dapat menyegarkan kembali nama baikmu 54 di dunia atas, tempat di mana diperbolehkan untuk kembali.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
55 E ’l tronco: «Sì col dolce dir m’adeschi, 56 ch’i’ non posso tacere; e voi non gravi 57 perch’ ïo un poco a ragionar m’inveschi.
query.result:
**English:**
55 And the trunk: "Yes, with your sweet speech you entice me, 56 that I cannot be silent; and do not think it burdensome 57 that I indulge myself a little in speaking.
**Malay:**
55 Dan batang pohon itu: "Ya, dengan ucapanmu yang manis kau bujuk aku, 56 sehingga aku tidak dapat berdiam diri; dan janganlah kalian merasa keberatan 57 karena aku sedikit memanjakan diriku untuk berbicara.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 Io son colui che tenni ambo le chiavi 59 del cor di Federigo, e che le volsi, 60 serrando e diserrando, sì soavi,
61 che dal secreto suo quasi ogn’ uom tolsi; 62 fede portai al glorïoso offizio, 63 tanto ch’i’ ne perde’ li sonni e ’ polsi.
query.result:
**English:**
58 I am the one who held both keys 59 of Frederick’s heart, and who turned them, 60 locking and unlocking, so gently,
61 that I took almost every man from his secret; 62 I bore faith to the glorious office, 63 so much that I lost sleep and strength for it.
**Malay:**
58 Akulah orang yang memegang kedua kunci 59 hati Frederick, dan yang memutarnya, 60 mengunci dan membuka, dengan lembut,
61 sehingga aku mengambil hampir setiap orang dari rahasianya; 62 Aku memikul tanggung jawab atas jabatan yang mulia itu, 63 sehingga aku kehilangan tidur dan tenaga karenanya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
64 La meretrice che mai da l’ospizio 65 di Cesare non torse li occhi putti, 66 morte comune e de le corti vizio,
67 infiammò contra me li animi tutti; 68 e li ’nfiammati infiammar sì Augusto, 69 che ’ lieti onor tornaro in tristi lutti.
query.result:
**English:**
64 The harlot who never turns away from Caesar’s hospitality, 65 did not avert her wanton eyes, 66 the common death and vice of courts,
67 inflamed all hearts against me; 68 and the inflamed ones so inflamed Augustus, 69 that my joyful honors turned to sorrowful mourning.
**Malay:**
64 Pelacur yang tidak pernah berpaling dari keramahan Caesar, 65 tidak mengalihkan pandangan matanya yang genit, 66 kematian yang umum dan kejahatan istana,
67 mengobarkan semua hati untuk menentangku; 68 dan yang berapi-api itu begitu mengobarkan Augustus, 69 sehingga kehormatan yang menyenangkan itu berubah menjadi duka yang menyedihkan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
70 L’animo mio, per disdegnoso gusto, 71 credendo col morir fuggir disdegno, 72 ingiusto fece me contra me giusto.
query.result:
**English:**
70 My soul, out of disdainful pleasure, 71 believing that by dying it would flee disdain, 72 unjustly made me, who was just, against myself.
**Malay:**
70 Jiwaku, karena rasa jijik yang berlebihan, 71 percaya bahwa dengan kematian ia akan lari dari rasa jijik, 72 secara tidak adil membuatku, yang adil, melawan diriku sendiri.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
73 Per le nove radici d’esto legno 74 vi giuro che già mai non ruppi fede 75 al mio segnor, che fu d’onor sì degno.
query.result:
**English:**
73 By the nine roots of this tree 74 I swear that I never broke faith 75 with my lord, who was so worthy of honor.
**Malay:**
73 Demi sembilan akar pohon ini 74 aku bersumpah bahwa aku tidak pernah mengingkari kesetiaan 75 kepada tuanku, yang sangat layak dihormati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
76 E se di voi alcun nel mondo riede, 77 conforti la memoria mia, che giace 78 ancor del colpo che ’nvidia le diede».
query.result:
**English:**
76 And if any of you return to the world, 77 comfort my memory, which still lies 78 under the blow that envy dealt it.
**Malay:**
76 Dan jika ada di antara kamu yang kembali ke dunia, 77 hiburlah ingatanku, yang masih terbaring 78 di bawah pukulan yang diberikan oleh rasa iri kepadanya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
79 Un poco attese, e poi «Da ch’el si tace», 80 disse ’l poeta a me, «non perder l’ora; 81 ma parla, e chiedi a lui, se più ti piace».
query.result:
**English:**
79 He waited a little, and then, “Since he is silent,” 80 the poet said to me, “do not waste the time; 81 but speak, and ask him, if it pleases you more.”
**Malay:**
79 Dia menunggu sebentar, dan kemudian, “Karena dia diam,” 80 penyair itu berkata kepadaku, “jangan buang waktu; 81 tetapi bicaralah, dan tanyakan kepadanya, jika itu lebih menyenangkan bagimu.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
82 Ond’ ïo a lui: «Domandal tu ancora 83 di quel che credi ch’a me satisfaccia; 84 ch’i’ non potrei, tanta pietà m’accora».
query.result:
**English:**
82 Then I said to him: "Ask me again 83 about what you think would satisfy me; 84 for I cannot speak, so much pity overwhelms me."
**Malay:**
82 Lalu aku berkata kepadanya: "Tanyakanlah kepadaku lagi 83 tentang apa yang menurutmu akan memuaskanku; 84 karena aku tidak dapat berbicara, begitu banyak belas kasihan yang menyedihkanku."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 Perciò ricominciò: «Se l’om ti faccia 86 liberamente ciò che ’l tuo dir priega, 87 spirito incarcerato, ancor ti piaccia
88 di dirne come l’anima si lega 89 in questi nocchi; e dinne, se tu puoi, 90 s’alcuna mai di tai membra si spiega».
query.result:
**English:**
85 Therefore he began again: "If a man 86 freely does for you what your speech entreats, 87 imprisoned spirit, may it still please you
88 to tell us how the soul is bound 89 in these knots; and tell us, if you can, 90 if any of these members ever breaks free."
**Malay:**
85 Oleh karena itu ia mulai lagi: "Jika manusia 86 dengan bebas melakukan untukmu apa yang diminta oleh ucapanmu, 87 roh yang terpenjara, semoga engkau masih berkenan
88 untuk memberi tahu kami bagaimana jiwa terikat 89 dalam simpul-simpul ini; dan beri tahu kami, jika engkau bisa, 90 apakah ada di antara anggota tubuh ini yang pernah terlepas."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
91 Allor soffiò il tronco forte, e poi 92 si convertì quel vento in cotal voce: 93 «Brievemente sarà risposto a voi.
query.result:
**English:**
91 Then the strong trunk blew, and then 92 that wind became a voice, saying: 93 "Briefly will be answered to you.
**Malay:**
91 Kemudian batang pohon yang kuat itu bertiup, dan kemudian 92 angin itu berubah menjadi suara, berkata: 93 "Sebentar lagi akan kujawab untukmu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
94 Quando si parte l’anima feroce 95 dal corpo ond’ ella stessa s’è disvelta, 96 Minòs la manda a la settima foce.
query.result:
**English:**
94 When the fierce soul departs 95 from the body from which it has torn itself, 96 Minos sends it to the seventh abyss.
**Malay:**
94 Ketika jiwa yang ganas meninggalkan 95 tubuh yang telah dilepaskannya sendiri, 96 Minos mengirimnya ke jurang ketujuh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
97 Cade in la selva, e non l’è parte scelta; 98 ma là dove fortuna la balestra, 99 quivi germoglia come gran di spelta.
query.result:
**English:**
97 He falls in the forest, and there is no choice of place; 98 but where fortune hurls him, 99 there he sprouts like a grain of spelt.
**Malay:**
97 Dia jatuh di hutan, dan tidak ada pilihan tempat; 98 tetapi di mana nasib melemparkannya, 99 di sana dia tumbuh seperti sebutir gandum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
100 Surge in vermena e in pianta silvestra: 101 l’Arpie, pascendo poi de le sue foglie, 102 fanno dolore, e al dolor fenestra.
query.result:
**English:**
100 It sprouts into a shoot and a wild plant: 101 the Harpies, feeding then on its leaves, 102 cause pain, and make a window for the pain.
**Malay:**
100 Ia tumbuh menjadi tunas dan tanaman liar: 101 Para Harpy, yang memakan dedaunannya, 102 menyebabkan rasa sakit, dan membuat jendela untuk rasa sakit itu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
103 Come l’altre verrem per nostre spoglie, 104 ma non però ch’alcuna sen rivesta, 105 ché non è giusto aver ciò ch’om si toglie.
query.result:
**English:**
103 As the others will come for our spoils, 104 but not so that anyone will wear them again, 105 because it is not right to have what one takes away.
**Malay:**
103 Seperti yang lain akan datang untuk rampasan kita, 104 tetapi bukan berarti ada yang akan memakainya lagi, 105 karena tidaklah benar memiliki apa yang diambil seseorang.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
106 Qui le strascineremo, e per la mesta 107 selva saranno i nostri corpi appesi, 108 ciascuno al prun de l’ombra sua molesta».
query.result:
**English:**
106 Here we will drag them, and through the sad 107 forest our bodies will be hung, 108 each one on the thorn of his own troublesome shade».
**Malay:**
106 Di sini kita akan menyeret mereka, dan melalui hutan yang menyedihkan 107 tubuh kita akan digantung, 108 masing-masing di duri bayangannya yang menyusahkan».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 Noi eravamo ancora al tronco attesi, 110 credendo ch’altro ne volesse dire, 111 quando noi fummo d’un romor sorpresi,
112 similemente a colui che venire 113 sente ’l porco e la caccia a la sua posta, 114 ch’ode le bestie, e le frasche stormire.
query.result:
**English:**
109 We were still waiting at the trunk, 110 believing that he wanted to say something else, 111 when we were surprised by a noise,
112 similar to the one who hears 113 the boar and the hunt coming to his post, 114 who hears the beasts and the rustling of the leaves.
**Malay:**
109 Kami masih menunggu di batang pohon, 110 percaya bahwa dia ingin mengatakan sesuatu yang lain, 111 ketika kami dikejutkan oleh suara,
112 sama seperti orang yang mendengar 113 babi hutan dan perburuan datang ke posnya, 114 yang mendengar binatang buas dan gemerisik dedaunan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
115 Ed ecco due da la sinistra costa, 116 nudi e graffiati, fuggendo sì forte, 117 che de la selva rompieno ogne rosta.
query.result:
**English:**
115 And behold, two figures on the left flank, 116 naked and scratched, fleeing so fast 117 that they broke every branch of the forest.
**Malay:**
115 Dan lihatlah, dua sosok di sisi kiri, 116 telanjang dan tergores, melarikan diri dengan sangat cepat, 117 sehingga mereka mematahkan setiap dahan di hutan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
118 Quel dinanzi: «Or accorri, accorri, morte!». 119 E l’altro, cui pareva tardar troppo, 120 gridava: «Lano, sì non furo accorte
121 le gambe tue a le giostre dal Toppo!».
query.result:
**English:**
118 The one in front: "Now run, run, death!". 119 And the other, who seemed to be too slow, 120 shouted: "Lano, your legs were not so nimble
121 at the joust at Toppo!".
**Malay:**
118 Yang di hadapan: "Sekarang lari, lari, kematian!". 119 Dan yang lain, yang tampaknya terlalu lambat, 120 berteriak: "Lano, kakimu tidak begitu gesit
121 pada pertandingan di Toppo!".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
122 E poi che forse li fallia la lena, 123 di sé e d’un cespuglio fece un groppo.
124 Di rietro a loro era la selva piena 125 di nere cagne, bramose e correnti 126 come veltri ch’uscisser di catena.
query.result:
**English:**
122 And then perhaps their strength failed them, 123 and he made a knot of himself and a bush.
124 Behind them the forest was full 125 of black hounds, eager and running 126 like greyhounds unleashed from a leash.
**Malay:**
122 Dan kemudian mungkin tenaga mereka habis, 123 dan dia membuat simpul dari dirinya sendiri dan semak-semak.
124 Di belakang mereka hutan itu penuh 125 dengan anjing-anjing hitam, bersemangat dan berlari 126 seperti anjing pemburu yang dilepaskan dari rantai.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
127 In quel che s’appiattò miser li denti, 128 e quel dilaceraro a brano a brano; 129 poi sen portar quelle membra dolenti.
query.result:
**English:**
127 He in whom she fixed her cruel teeth, 128 and tore him limb from limb; 129 then she carried away his suffering limbs.
**Malay:**
127 Dia yang digigit giginya yang kejam, 128 dan dicabik-cabik; 129 kemudian dia membawa anggota tubuhnya yang menderita itu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
130 Presemi allor la mia scorta per mano, 131 e menommi al cespuglio che piangea 132 per le rotture sanguinenti in vano.
query.result:
**English:**
130 Then I took my guide by the hand, 131 and he led me to the bush that was weeping 132 in vain for its bloody wounds.
**Malay:**
130 Kemudian aku memegang tanganku pemanduku, 131 dan dia membawaku ke semak-semak yang menangis 132 dengan sia-sia karena luka-lukanya yang berdarah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
133 «O Iacopo», dicea, «da Santo Andrea, 134 che t’è giovato di me fare schermo? 135 che colpa ho io de la tua vita rea?».
query.result:
**English:**
133 "O Jacopo," he said, "from Santo Andrea, 134 what good did it do you to shield yourself with me? 135 what fault of mine led to your wicked life?"
**Malay:**
133 "Wahai Jacopo," katanya, "dari Santo Andrea, 134 apa gunanya bagimu menjadikan aku sebagai tameng? 135 salahku apa sehingga hidupmu menjadi jahat?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
136 Quando ’l maestro fu sovr’ esso fermo, 137 disse: «Chi fosti, che per tante punte 138 soffi con sangue doloroso sermo?».
query.result:
**English:**
136 When the master was standing over him, 137 he said: "Who were you, that through so many wounds 138 you breathed out your painful speech with blood?".
**Malay:**
136 Ketika sang guru berdiri di atasnya dengan teguh, 137 berkata: "Siapakah engkau, yang melalui begitu banyak luka 138 engkau hembuskan ucapanmu yang menyakitkan dengan darah?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
139 Ed elli a noi: «O anime che giunte 140 siete a veder lo strazio disonesto 141 c’ha le mie fronde sì da me disgiunte,
142 raccoglietele al piè del tristo cesto.
query.result:
**English:**
139 And he to us: "O souls who have arrived 140 to see the shameful torment 141 that has so separated my leaves from me,
142 gather them at the foot of the sad bush.
**Malay:**
139 Dan dia kepada kami: "Wahai jiwa-jiwa yang telah tiba 140 untuk melihat siksaan yang memalukan 141 yang telah memisahkan dedaunan dariku,
142 kumpulkanlah mereka di kaki semak yang menyedihkan itu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
143 I’ fui de la città che nel Batista 144 mutò ’l primo padrone; ond’ ei per questo
145 sempre con l’arte sua la farà trista; 146 e se non fosse che ’n sul passo d’Arno 147 rimane ancor di lui alcuna vista,
148 que’ cittadin che poi la rifondarno 149 sovra ’l cener che d’Attila rimase, 150 avrebber fatto lavorare indarno.
query.result:
**English:**
143 I was from the city that, under the Baptist, 144 changed its first patron; for which reason 145 he will always make it sad with his art; 146 and if it were not that on the bank of the Arno 147 there still remains some sight of him,
148 those citizens who later refounded it 149 on the ashes that remained from Attila, 150 would have labored in vain.
**Malay:**
143 Aku berasal dari kota yang, di bawah sang Pembaptis, 144 mengubah pelindung pertamanya; karena alasan ini 145 ia akan selalu membuatnya sedih dengan seninya; 146 dan jika bukan karena di tepi sungai Arno 147 masih ada beberapa pemandangan dirinya,
148 para warga kota yang kemudian membangunnya kembali 149 di atas abu yang tersisa dari Attila, 150 akan bekerja dengan sia-sia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
151 Io fei gibetto a me de le mie case».
query.result:
**English:**
151 I made a gibbet for myself out of my houses.
**Malay:**
151 Aku membuat tiang gantungan untuk diriku sendiri dari rumah-rumahku.
